sentence.Network_en: She studied him for the longest time, looking wryly amused.
sentence.Network_cn: 她面带苦笑，盯着他看了很长时间。

sentence.Network_en: He finished his conversation and stood up, looking straight at me.
sentence.Network_cn: 他说完话站起来，直视着我。

sentence.Network_en: Joseph watched a shady-looking bunch playing cards aboard a Mississippi steamer.
sentence.Network_cn: 约瑟夫看到一群可疑的人在密西西比河的一艘轮船上打牌。

PerfectNetExp.abs: We ' re looking for a drugstore to buy medicine ., 我们找一家药店 , 买药.
i saw everything , but wasn ' t looking ., 一切入我眼帘 , 可我不曾放眼.
The MICE world is always looking for new destinations , new experiences ., 会展市场一直在寻求全新的目的地和承办方.
yeah , i was looking for a salon job for a month ., 我想找份在美容沙龙的工作都找了一个月了.

list.abs: 广州鹭珂鸶(LOOKSEE)服饰有限公司就是其中的佼佼者。他们赋予源于台湾的鹭珂鸶品牌“高瞻远瞩 ”的涵义，延续了台湾高山族的内 …
人教版八年级上册英语单词表（含音标） ... 34 of course 当然 35 look after 照顾；照看 36 lifestyle n. 生活方式.
大学英语四级常用词组 ... look in 顺便看望，顺便访问 look into 观察；调查；窥视 look on 旁观；观看；面向.
初中英语短语大全 ... 46．have meals 吃饭 47．look for 寻找 48．the first floor 第一层.

collins.item: USING YOUR EYES OR YOUR MIND

entry.def: If you look in a particular direction, you direct your eyes in that direction, especially so that you can see what is there or see what something is like.

example.ex: I looked down the hallway to room number nine...
example.tran: 我顺着走廊看了一眼9号房。

example.ex: She  turned to look at him...
example.tran: 她转头看他。

entry.def: If you look at a book, newspaper, or magazine, you read it fairly quickly or read part of it.

example.ex: You've  just got to look at the last bit of Act Three.
example.tran: 你只要看一下第3幕最后那部分。

entry.def: If someone, especially an expert, looks at something, they examine it, and then deal with it or say how it should be dealt with.

example.ex: Can you look at my back? I think something's  wrong.
example.tran: 您能看一下我的背吗？我觉得有点儿不对劲。

entry.def: If you look at someone in a particular way, you look at them with your expression showing what you are feeling or thinking.

example.ex: She looked at him earnestly. 'You don't mind?'
example.tran: 她认真地看着他说：“你不介意吗？”

entry.def: If you look for something, for example something that you have lost, you try to find it.

example.ex: I'm looking for a child. I believe your husband can help me find her...
example.tran: 我在找一个小孩。我相信你丈夫可以帮我找到她。

example.ex: I had gone to Maine looking for a place to work...
example.tran: 我去了缅因州找工作。

entry.tran: 寻找，寻求，谋求（解决方案或新的方法）
entry.def: If you are looking for something such as the solution to a problem or a new method, you want it and are trying to obtain it or think of it.

example.ex: The working group will be looking for practical solutions to the problems faced by doctors...
example.tran: 工作小组将寻求切实可行的方案，以解决医生们遇到的难题。

example.ex: He's looking for a way out from this conflict.
example.tran: 他正在想办法摆脱这一纷争。

entry.def: If you look at a subject, problem, or situation, you think about it or study it, so that you know all about it and can perhaps consider what should be done in relation to it.

example.ex: Next term we'll  be looking at the Second World War period...
example.tran: 下学期咱们会研究二战时期…

example.ex: Anne Holker looks at the pros and cons of making changes to your property...
example.tran: 安妮·霍尔克负责权衡你房屋改造的利与弊。

entry.def: If you look at a person, situation, or subject from a particular point of view, you judge them or consider them from that point of view.

example.ex: Brian had learned to look at her with new respect...
example.tran: 布赖恩看她时变得多了一分尊重。

example.ex: It depends how you look at it.
example.tran: 这要看你怎么看待它。

entry.tran: （用于唤起他人注意）瞧，听着，听我说
entry.def: You say look when you want someone to pay attention to you because you are going to say something important.

example.ex: Look, I'm sorry. I didn't  mean it...
example.tran: 哎，对不起。我不是故意的。

example.ex: Now, look, here is how things stand.
example.tran: 现在听好啦，情况眼下是这样的。

entry.tran: （用于让他人注意令人惊讶、重要或使人厌烦的事）瞧，看看
entry.def: You can use look to draw attention to a particular situation, person, or thing, for example because you find it very surprising, significant, or annoying.

example.ex: Hey, look at the time! We'll talk about it tonight. All right?...
example.tran: 嘿，看看都几点啦？咱们晚上再讨论，好不好？

example.ex: I mean, look at how many people watch television and how few read books...
example.tran: 我是说，你瞧看电视的有多少人，看书的又有几个。

entry.tran: （建筑物、窗户等）面向，朝向对着
entry.def: If something such as a building or window looks somewhere, it has a view of a particular place.

example.ex: The castle looks over private parkland...
example.tran: 城堡俯瞰一片私家绿地。

example.ex: Each front door looks across a narrow alley to the front door opposite.
example.tran: 家家大门对大门，中间隔着一条窄巷。

entry.def: If you are looking to do something, you are aiming to do it.

example.ex: We're not looking to make a fortune.
example.tran: 我们没打算大赚一笔。

example.ex: ...young mums looking to get fit after having kids.
example.tran: 生完孩子后打算瘦身的年轻妈妈们

entry.tran: 从此一帆风顺；此后蒸蒸日上
entry.def: If you say that someone did something and then never looked back, you mean that they were very successful from that time on.

example.ex: I went freelance when my son Adam was born, and have never looked back.
example.tran: 我在儿子亚当出世后开始从事自由职业，自此一帆风顺。

entry.def: If you look someone in the eye or look them in the face, you look straight at their eyes in a bold and open way, for example in order to make them realize that you are telling the truth.

example.ex: He could not look her in the eye.
example.tran: 他不敢直视她的眼睛。

entry.def: If you say that someone looks the other way, you are critical of them because they pay no attention to something unpleasant that is happening, when they should be dealing with it properly.

example.ex: Judges and politicians routinely looked the other way while people were tortured or killed by police.
example.tran: 法官和政客对警察虐待或杀人之事常常装聋作哑。

entry.tran: （尤用于对某人言行感到恼火时）喂，你听我说
entry.def: You say look here when you are going to say something important to someone, especially when you are angry at what they have done or said.

example.ex: Now look here, Tim, there really is no need for that kind of reaction.
example.tran: 你听我说，蒂姆，你这种反应真的没必要。

entry.def: If you say or shout 'look out!' to someone, you are warning them that they are in danger.

example.ex: 'Look out!' somebody shouted, as the truck started to roll toward the sea.
example.tran: 卡车冲向大海时，有人大喊“当心！”

entry.def: If someone looks you up and down, they direct their eyes from your head to your feet, in a rude and superior way and often as though they disapprove of you.

example.ex: The sales assistant looked me up and down and told me not to try the dress on because she didn't think I would get into it.
example.tran: 那个女店员对我上下打量了一番后，叫我不要试穿那条裙子，因为她认为我穿不上。

entry.def: You use look when describing the appearance of a person or thing or the impression that they give.

example.ex: Sheila was looking miserable...
example.tran: 希拉看上去愁眉苦脸的。

example.ex: I shall use the money to make my home look lovely...
example.tran: 我要用这笔钱把家里搞得漂漂亮亮的。

entry.def: If someone or something has a particular look, they have a particular appearance or expression.

example.ex: She had the look of someone deserted and betrayed...
example.tran: 她一副遭人遗弃和背叛的样子。

example.ex: When he came to decorate the kitchen, Kenneth opted for a friendly rustic look...
example.tran: 装修厨房的时候，肯尼思选择的是一种亲切质朴的田园风格。

entry.def: When you refer to someone's looks, you are referring to how beautiful or ugly they are, especially how beautiful they are.

example.ex: I never chose people just because of their looks.
example.tran: 我从不以貌取人。

example.ex: ...a young woman with wholesome good looks.
example.tran: 健康、美丽的年轻女子

entry.def: You use look when indicating what you think will happen in the future or how a situation seems to you.

example.ex: He had lots of time to think about the future, and it didn't look good...
example.tran: 他有很多时间考虑将来，但情况似乎并不乐观。

example.ex: Britain looks set to send a major force of over 100 tanks and supporting equipment...
example.tran: 看来，英国已下决心要派遣一支配备有百余坦克和支援装备的主力部队。

entry.def: You use expressions such as by the look of him and by the looks of it when you want to indicate that you are giving an opinion based on the appearance of someone or something.

example.ex: He was not a well man by the look of him...
example.tran: 外表看来，他不太健康。

example.ex: By the look of things, Mr Stone and company will stay busy.
example.tran: 照目前的情况看，斯通先生他们还有的忙。

entry.def: If you don't like the look of something or someone, you feel that they may be dangerous or cause problems.

example.ex: I don't like the look of those clouds.
example.tran: 看那些云的样子，我觉得可能要下雨。

entry.def: If you ask what someone or something looks like, you are asking for a description of them.

means.word_mean: 1. the act of directing the eyes toward something and perceiving it visually;

sentences.sentence: "he went out to have a look"
"his look was fixed on her eyes"
"he gave it a good looking at"
"his camera does his looking for him"

means.word_mean: 1. appearing to be as specified; usually used as combining forms;

auth_sentence.content: It isn't as cuddly-looking as a giant panda.
auth_sentence.res_content: It isn't as cuddly-looking as a giant panda.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It isn't as cuddly-looking as a giant panda.

auth_sentence.content: Let's hear what Shawn is looking forward to.
auth_sentence.res_content: Let's hear what Shawn is looking forward to.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Let's hear what Shawn is looking forward to.

auth_sentence.content: How about looking at salaries at the same time?
auth_sentence.res_content: How about looking at salaries at the same time?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: How about looking at salaries at the same time?

Sentence.sentence: Once she lost a two-cent stamp and spent the night looking for it.
Worst of all, when her son, Ned, fell and injured his knee, she refused to pay for a doctor and spent hours looking for free medical help
I'm looking for the manager's office.

If you say no, however, it may surprise you to learn that you are only unemployed if you've been actively looking for work in the past four weeks; otherwise, you are "marginally attached to the labor force" and not actually unemployed

Democrats and Republicans can and will take sides on a number of issues, but a more crucial concern is that both are basing major policy decisions on guesstimates rather than looking at the vast wealth of raw data with a critical eye and an open mind.
